meanings.definition: A spar extending forward from the bow of a ship, to which the forestays are fastened.
meanings.sent1: The bowsprits on the ship help keep the mast steady in rough waters.
meanings.sent2: The sailors secured the sails to the bowsprits before setting off on their voyage.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on the bowsprits, pretending to be the captain of the ship.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the bowsprits cast long shadows on the deck, resembling giant fingers reaching out.
meanings.sent5: During the storm, the creaking of the bowsprits could be heard above the roaring waves.

meanings.definition: The part of a ship's bow that extends beyond the stem.
meanings.sent1: The bowsprits of the old vessel were beautifully carved and painted.
meanings.sent2: The waves crashed against the bowsprits, sending sprays of salty water into the air.
meanings.sent3: The curious dolphin swam playfully around the bowsprits, as if playing a game of tag.
meanings.sent4: In the moonlight, the bowsprits gleamed like silver swords pointing towards the stars.
meanings.sent5: The bowsprits jutted out proudly, leading the way through the vast ocean.
